Package ohos.ivi.drivingsafety

Class DrivingSafetyConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivi.drivingsafety.DrivingSafetyConfig

  • public class DrivingSafetyConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides the control policies for system capabilities and applications.

    You can use the methods in this class to customize control policies for system applications (such as settings and contacts) and system capabilities (such as the input method engine and video playback).

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.DrivingSafety

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  DrivingSafetyConfig.SysDrivingSafetyControlItems
      Enumerates system capabilities that can be controlled by users in driving mode.

    • Method Detail

      • setSysDrivingSafetyConfigure

        public static int setSysDrivingSafetyConfigure​(DrivingSafetyConfig.SysDrivingSafetyControlItems item,
                                               boolean isOpen)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               ohos.rpc.RemoteException
        Sets the control policy for a specified system capability when the current vehicle enters the driving mode.

        This method determines whether the specified system capability, for example, video playback or input method engine, is under driving-mode safety control. If it is under control, third-party applications are prohibited from invoking it to ensure driving safety.

        Code example: 

         boolean isOpen = true;
 int ret = 0;
 try {
     ret = DrivingSafetyConfig.setSysDrivingSafetyConfigure(SysDrivingSafetyControlItems.DM_IME, isOpen);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
     ret = -1;
 }
        Parameters:
        item - Indicates the SysDrivingSafetyControlItems object, which identifies the specified system capability.
        isOpen - Specifies whether to enable the control policy. The value true indicates that the control policy is enabled, and the value false indicates disabled.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the setting succeeded; returns another integer as an error code if the setting failed.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if the internal communication is abnormal. In this case, try again later.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is incorrect. In this case, check the input parameter.
        Since:
        1

      • getSysDrivingSafetyConfigure

        public static int getSysDrivingSafetyConfigure​(DrivingSafetyConfig.SysDrivingSafetyControlItems item,
                                               DrivingSafetyConfigResult result)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               ohos.rpc.RemoteException
        Queries the control policy for a specified system capability when the current vehicle enters the driving mode.

        Code example: 

         DrivingSafetyConfigResult result = new DrivingSafetyConfigResult();
 int ret = 0;
 try {
     ret = DrivingSafetyConfig.getSysDrivingSafetyConfigure(SysDrivingSafetyControlItems.DM_IME, result);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
     ret = -1;
 }
 boolean isOpen = result.isOpen();
        Parameters:
        item - Indicates the SysDrivingSafetyControlItems object, which identifies the specified system capability.
        result - Indicates the DrivingSafetyConfigResult object, which contains the return value of isOpen(). The return value true indicates that the control policy is enabled, and the return value false indicates disabled.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the query succeeded; returns another integer as an error code if the query failed.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if the internal communication is abnormal. In this case, try again later.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is incorrect. In this case, check the input parameter.
        Since:
        1
